the death mechanism is work with master/worker's  suicide.

when the zk session timeout is too short(default is 60s), 
the worker or master loss connection from the zk. remove the `nodes/master/ip:port` node.
other master/worker will watch this event and add the node to  `nodes/dead-servers/ip:port`.

so when the master/worker's network recover and reconnect to zk .
it will revieve the dead node add event, and kill itself.

> the death mechanism is work with master/worker's suicide.
> 
> when the zk session timeout is too short(default is 60s), the worker or master loss connection from the zk. remove the `nodes/master/ip:port` node. other master/worker will watch this event and add the node to `nodes/dead-servers/ip:port`.
> 
> so when the master/worker's network recover and reconnect to zk . it will revieve the dead node add event, and kill itself.
>

### Search before asking

-[X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/dolphinscheduler/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar issues.


### What happened

task submit is succeed but cannot be executed for a long time.

After the workflow is called up, the task is submitted successfully, there is a submission log in the master, and the database status is 0, but it has been hanging and has not been executed; the cluster resources are sufficient, the worker services are normal, and the grouping is correct; there are also workers in zk

### What you expected to happen

sometimes the worker's logs report: io.netty.channel.unix.Errors$NativeIoException: readAddress(..) failed: Connection timed out,
possiblly the Netty channel time out

After the master process, the worker did not receive the message, which may be caused by the channel connection timeout

### How to reproduce

execute a flow, which state is succeed; but task can not running

The workflow is running, and the workflow status is running; the task is submitted successfully, and the gray dot is displayed, and it has not been executed.

### Anything else

[issues 3789](https://github.com/apache/dolphinscheduler/issues/3789) This issue was merged and released in version 1.3.3, but the following two pieces of code were not found in the release code

1. Dolphin will first start a sudo root process
2. When kill, kill all child processes, the sudo process will also end
3. For this piece, why remove the first pid, because the first pid is a root-level process 

```java
  pidList = pidList.subList(1, pidList.size());
```
When using sudo -u tenant kill -9 pids, it will report insufficient permissions. If this is changed to sudo kill -9 pids, there is no need to remove the first pid above.

If you start each service separately for local development, you need to specify SPRING_PROFILES_ACTIVE=the database you want at startup
Or you can try to start standalone-server
